conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and effects of light source movement.
Light source is positioned above objects, casting shadows A, B, C, and D on the ground.
Shadows are formed by obstruction of light by objects.
Moving the light source forward changes the angle at which light rays hit the objects.
Shadows will shift and change in size based on the new angle of light.
Shadows will move backward as the light source moves forward.
Shadows move backward because light rays intersect the ground at a different point behind the objects.
Size of shadows will generally increase as the light source moves forward.
Increased angle between light rays and ground causes shadows to stretch out more.
Shadow A (Mushroom) will move backward and become larger as the light source moves forward.
Shadow B (Rock) will move backward and increase in size.
Shadow C (Vase) will move backward and become larger.
Shadow D (Book) will move backward and increase in size.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move backward and increase in size.
